definition.ESRF_description: Techniques used to collect this dataset
Technique used to collect this dataset

beamSizeAtSampleX.ESRF_description: Horizontal beam size in mm at sample position

beamSizeAtSampleY.ESRF_description: Vertical beam size in mm at sample position

detectorDistance.ESRF_description: Detector to sample distance in mm

flux.ESRF_description: Flux in photon/s before data collection

fluxEnd.ESRF_description: Flux in photon/s before data collection

propagation.ESRF_description: Propagation may be near or far

beamSize.ESRF_description: Beam size on the sample in microns

name.ESRF_description: Scan motor in the horizontal direction

range.ESRF_description: Range of the moves in microns

name.ESRF_description: Scan motor in the horizontal direction

range.ESRF_description: Range of the moves in microns

zStart.ESRF_description: initial position of the motor 1st stage

zStep.ESRF_description: Sample vertical translation for reference images

xshutterTime.ESRF_description: Detector shutter closing time during readout

nested.ESRF_description: Nested case for topotomo if set

noImagesAtEnd.ESRF_description: Do not take images at end of scan if set

readSrcur.ESRF_description: Read beam intensity in real time if set

saveSeparateDarkImage.ESRF_description: Do not save a unique dark file if set

accExposureTime.ESRF_description: Time of 1 frame in accumulation mode

accFramesCount.ESRF_description: Number of frames in accumulation mode

beamCheck.ESRF_description: Suspend scan if no beam if set

camXMot.ESRF_description: Motor to move detector along beam axis

imagesAtEndAsQuali.ESRF_description: Using images at end as quali if set

latencyTime.ESRF_description: Extra readout time for detector at each projection

liveCorrection.ESRF_description: Dark fields recorded befor scan if set

magnification.ESRF_description: Magnification of pixel size due to optics

manualPixelSize.ESRF_description: Force user to indicate pixel size if set

monoTuneOnRef.ESRF_description: Tune mono before taking references if set

noAccelCorr.ESRF_description: Correct motion at acceleration if set

noRefAtEnd.ESRF_description: Take references at the end of the scan if set

openSlitsOnQuali.ESRF_description: Enlarge the beam for quaki images if set

opticsEyePiece.ESRF_description: Magnification factor obtained from optics name

refPower.ESRF_description: Manage references motor power if set

roundingCorrection.ESRF_description: Apply rounding corrections when steps/projs not int if set

safeTime.ESRF_description: Extra readout time for detector at each projection

monoTuneOnStart.ESRF_description: Tune mono befor scan starts if set

interlaced_roundtrip.ESRF_description: boolean : Same or opposite directions when interlacing

sampleDetectorDistances.ESRF_description: Sample/detector distances for all planes used

sourceSampleDistances.ESRF_description: Source/sample distances for all planes used

im01NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last sample image in plane 1

im01NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first sample image in plane 1

im02NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last sample image in plane 2

im02NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first sample image in plane 2

im03NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last sample image in plane 3

im03NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first sample image in plane 3

im04NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last sample image in plane 4

im04NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first sample image in plane 4

ref01NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last reference image in plane 1

ref02NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last reference image in plane 2

ref02NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first reference image in plane 2

ref03NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last reference image in plane 3

ref03NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first reference image in plane 3

ref04NumEnd.ESRF_description: Index of last reference image in plane 4

ref04NumStart.ESRF_description: Index of first reference image in plane 4

pixelSize.ESRF_description: Pixel size of first distance in micron

definition.ESRF_description: Technique used to collect this dataset

distance.ESRF_description: Translation of the sample along the Z-direction of the laboratory coordinate system

situation.ESRF_description: The atmosphere will be one of the components, which is where its details will be stored; the relevant components will be indicated by the entry in the sample_component member.

ub_matrix.ESRF_description: UB matrix of single crystal sample using Busing-Levy convention: W. R. Busing and H. A. Levy (1967). Acta Cryst. 22, 457-464. This is the multiplication of the orientation_matrix, given above, with the BB matrix which can be derived from the lattice constants.

name.ESRF_description: Apparatus identification code/model number; e.g. OC100 011

type.ESRF_description: Type of apparatus. This could be the SE codes in scheduling database; e.g. OC/100

description.ESRF_description: Description of the apparatus; e.g. 100mm bore orange cryostat with Roots pump

lens_geometry.ESRF_description: Geometry of the lens. Any of these values:paraboloid,spherical,elliptical,hyperbolical

focus_type.ESRF_description: The type of focus of the lens. Any of these values:line,point

curvature.ESRF_description: Radius of the curvature as measured in the middle of the lens

number_of_lenses.ESRF_description: Number of lenses that make up the compound lens

lens_material.ESRF_description: Material used to make the lens

lens_geometry.ESRF_description: Geometry of the lens. Any of these values:paraboloid,spherical,elliptical,hyperbolical

live_time.ESRF_description: Time the detector has been actually measuring (elapsed_time - dead_time)

elapsed_time.ESRF_description: Time elapsed between start and stop of the measurement

calibration.ESRF_description: For MCA detectors, coefficients a, b, c to compute a scale based on channel number as a + b * x + c * x * x

group.ESRF_description: Names and parameters describing the ROIs applied
group.name: ${InstrumentDetector01Rois_name}

value.ESRF_description: Parameters defining the ROI. Format: R1P1,R1P2 R2P1,R2P2 ... RnP1,RnP2
